title: From John O'Groats to Land's End; Or, 1372 miles on foot; A book of days and chronicle of adventures by two pedestrians on tour
author: Naylor, John Anderton
snippet: He was born at Foulshiels, Yarrow, in the sameyear as Sir Walter Scott, 1771, just one hundred years before our visit,and, after studying for the Church, adopted medicine as his profession.

title: Spare hours.
author: Brown, John
snippet: And there is Black Andro and Glowr owr'em and Foulshiels,  where Park was born and bred ; and there is the deep pool in the Yarrow where Scott found him plunging one stone after another into the water, and watching anxiously  the bubbles as they rose to the surface.

title: Spare hours.
author: Brown, John
snippet: " Fair Philiphaugh is mine by right, And Lewinshope still mine shall be; Newark, Foulshiels, and Tinnies baith My bow and arrow purchased m<».

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: Another story is that the bearer flung it into acottage at Foulshiels, and escaped for bis life.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: It then passed to Philiphaugh, Foulshiels, Lewinshope, Tinnis, the Manse,Whitehope, Sundhope, Bengerburn, Mount Benger,Dryhope, Henderland, and at last reached Mr JamesAnderson at Syart.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: The old house at Foulshiels, in which MungoPark was born, shows by the windows such anarrangement.
